DataElement.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Post Neoadjuvant Therapy Involved Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was evaluation or systematic appraisal of the first lymph node(s) that the cancer may spread, located in the armpit that drains the lymphatic vessels that originate from the breast tissue following neoadjuvant chemotherapy treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Post Neoadjuvant Therapy Involved
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the evaluation or systematic appraisal of the first lymph node(s) where cancer may spread located in the armpit that drains the lymphatic vessels that originate from the breast tissue following neoadjuvant therapy, treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: The first lymph node that is affected by cancer spread from the primary site.  Sentinel lymph node biopsy is part of the staging work-up to determine early metastasis to regional lymph nodes in patients with breast carcinoma or melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:Treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents. Induction therapy is followed by additional therapy to eliminate whatever cancer remains.:Involved; connected by participation or association or use.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.
Involved; connected by participation or association or use.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.
